description.narrative: El Salvador II - Human Capital Project: This project will focus on preparing the people of El Salvador to better meet the demands of a global economy. MCC will invest in approximately 400 schools in the coastal zone of El Salvador, focusing on grades 7-12, where dropout rates are the highest. MCC will also support reforms in technical and vocational education and training to ensure an integrated system that better matches the skills delivered by education providers with the demands of the private labor market. Through improving the quality of education in El Salvador, students will graduate with skills that better meet the needs of employers.

condition.narrative: Prior to the Disbursement of Program Funding after the first year of the Compact for the Implementation of the Full-Time Inclusive Model Sub-Activity, MINED will have adopted an operations and maintenance (?O&M?) plan under the Compact that provides the annual budget, and subsequent disbursements for planning and administration of O&M school funding, satisfactory to MCC.

Prior to the Disbursement of Program Funding for staff, consultants, advisors for the operation and technical assistance to the Board of Sector Committees ("Board") under the Integrated Technical Education and Professional Training Systems Sub-Activity after the end of the fourth year of the Compact, the Board will have adopted a plan, satisfactory to MCC, to absorb an increasing amount of costs so that by the end of the Compact, the Board will be fully financially sustainable and operational pursuant to that plan.

Prior to the Disbursement of Program Funding for the Education Quality Activity after the second year of the Compact, MCC and the Government will have agreed on, and the Government will have adopted, a plan for the continuous professional development for teachers in the 45 school clusters focused on achieving measurable improvements in teacher performance, and a plan for the provision of technical assistance for school directors in the 45 school clusters; the development and adoption of the plan for the continuous professional development of teachers will include collaboration with public and private institutions including, but not limited to, the National University of El Salvador and private universities providing teacher formation.

Prior to the Disbursement of any Program Funding for the National Education Evaluation Unit ("Evaluation Unit") within MINED under the Strengthening the National Education System Sub-Activity, MINED will have adopted a plan ("Evaluation Unit Funding Plan"), satisfactory to MCC under the terms of the Compact, to absorb an increasing amount of the costs for the Evaluation Unit, initially using the Government Contribution destined for this Sub-Activity and progressively transitioning to fund from its national budget, separate from the Government Contribution, so that by the end of the fourth year of the Compact, the Government will fully fund the Evaluation Unit pursuant to that plan. The Disbursement of Program Funding for the Evaluation Unit during the Compact will be subject to continued satisfaction of the Government's funding commitments pursuant to the Evaluation Unit Funding Plan.

Prior to the Disbursement of any Program Funding for the staff, consultants, advisors for the operation and technical assistance to the Technical Education and Professional Training Coordination Council ("Council") under the Integrated Technical Education and Professional Training Systems Sub-Activity, an adequate legal or public policy instrument, satisfactory to MCC, will have been executed, passed, or adopted for the creation of the Council no later than May 31, 2019. Continued disbursements to support the Council will be subject to the Council having adopted a plan, satisfactory to MCC, by the end of the fourth year of the Compact to absorb an increasing amount of costs so that by the end of the Compact, the Council will be fully financially sustainable and operational pursuant to that plan.

Prior to the eighth Disbursement of Program Funding for the Full-Time Inclusive Model Sub-Activity, MINED will have adopted a plan that details how it will include in its annual budget the recurring costs associated with the full-time inclusive model implemented under this Sub-Activity for each school based on the prioritization of needs identified by each school council as may be adjusted on an annual basis, satisfactory to MCC. Continued Disbursements for this Sub-Activity will be subject to MINED?s continued reassessment of the budgeting as local needs evolve and the full-time inclusive model is expanded, the budgeting and the expenditure of funds pursuant to such plan.

Prior to the release of any bid package for works or construction for any school under the Human Capital Project, the Government will resolve any land title issue pertaining to that school, to the satisfaction of MCC. Prior to the Disbursement of Program Funding for schools under the Implementation of Full-Time Inclusive Model Sub-Activity, the Government?s Ministry of Education (?MINED?) will have developed an executable plan with a milestones schedule, satisfactory to MCC, to resolve the land titling for those schools.
